name: PIE Vulnerability
description: The binary is built without Position Independent Code flag. In order to prevent an attacker from reliably jumping to, for example, a particular exploited function in memory, Address space layout randomization (ASLR) randomly arranges the address space positions of key data areas of a process, including the base of the executable and the positions of the stack,heap and libraries.
remediation: Use compiler option -fPIC to enable Position Independent Code.
